My wife's boyfriend really loves this game, so I thought I'd give it a try. The game is beautiful to say the least... the graphics are phenomenal on my onboard Intel¬Æ HD Graphics 630, the soundtrack among the best music I have ever heard, in my opinion far surpassing the works of the likes of Bach, Mozart and Ice Cube. The plot is extremely engaging and the characters are magnificently developed, some characters you just can't help but to love as though they were your own family. The game runs smoothly at a solid 18fps (The most the human eye can process) even in the most strenuous situations, with as many as 4 Jewish Bar Mitzvahs on screen at the same time. Overall, I feel I am obligated to say that this game is not only my personal game of the year, but my favourite game of all time. To anybody who can scrounge up the ¬£0.00 from the back of their greasy, Cheez-It covered sofa, I implore you to buy this game today.

Regards, Frog
